quiz.question: What is the 'J-curve' effect in currency adjustment?
options: Imports stop completely after currency fall
Trade balance initially worsens then improves after depreciation

Holding equal amounts of two currencies

options: It tends to weaken the currency
It tends to strengthen the currency

Fully fixed rates with zero intervention
Complete absence of foreign currency transactions

Exchange rates float freely with market forces
